Blade.Action: Intervenes to stop the assault on Dennis, confronting the attackers.
Displays a cold and pitiless gaze, showing no empathy toward the vampire club-goers.
Uses lethal force without hesitation, firing weapons to kill vampires.
Reveals a well-prepared arsenal of specialized weapons and body armor, demonstrating readiness and tactical planning.
Maintains a cold, pitiless gaze that intimidates vampire adversaries, showing confidence and psychological control.
Fires silver-tipped dum-dum bullets with precision, effectively neutralizing multiple enemies quickly.
Uses extreme violence and torture methods on Quinn without showing mercy or attempts at dialogue.
Calmly handles a dangerous situation with focus and control, avoiding unnecessary cruelty beyond what is needed to subdue the enemy.

Uses a stake to incapacitate Quinn by shoving it through his larynx, then fires cross-bow bolts precisely to pin Quinn to the wall, disables a security camera with a bolt, and uses a white phosphorous grenade effectively to eliminate Quinn.
Calmly assesses the situation, tries to interrogate Quinn for information, and when met with resistance, switches tactics efficiently.
Grabs Dennis by the jaw to check for bite marks, then leaves him alone after confirming he is unharmed.
Adjusts his footfall to spare a cockroach from being crushed.
Shoves a grenade in Quinn's mouth and detonates it, killing him brutally.
Shoves a grenade into Quinn's mouth and pulls the pin, effectively eliminating a threat decisively.
Surveys the aftermath calmly, noting the complete destruction of vampire evidence, showing awareness and thoroughness.
Checks Dennis carefully for bite marks by physically inspecting him, demonstrating methodical and practical investigative skill.
Adjusts his footfall to avoid killing a cockroach, indicating attention to detail and control even in small matters.
No direct action or statement by Blade in this excerpt; Curtis and Karen are the focus.
No direct actions or statements by Blade in this excerpt to evaluate competence.
Shoots Quinn to save Karen from being killed.
Arrives armed with a streetsweeper auto-shotgun, calmly sizing up a dangerous opponent.
Rolls to the side to avoid a heavy steel door flung at him, showing quick reflexes and situational awareness.
Allows Quinn to escape through the window after crashing through the wall, potentially missing an opportunity to stop him.
Hesitates before leaving Karen bleeding, wrestles with conscience, then chooses to save her despite police threats.
Ignores police commands and risks a dangerous jump to save Karen.
Rolls to the side to avoid a heavy steel door flung at him.
Hesitates briefly before deciding to save Karen despite the danger.
Ignores armed policemen and chooses to jump a nearly impossible distance to save Karen.
Almost fails the jump, but manages a last-second save to prevent Karen from falling.
Saves Karen from falling, despite the danger and her screams.
Brutally pops Karen's dislocated shoulder back into place without consideration for her pain.
Curses himself for giving into his emotions, showing self-awareness and concern.
Brutally pops Karen's dislocated shoulder back into place despite her screams, showing medical or physical skill and decisiveness.
Quickly gets Karen into his high-performance car and drives through dangerous neighborhoods to a secure location, demonstrating planning and confident navigation.
Uses a remote secured to the sun visor to open a heavily secured gate, indicating preparedness and technical savvy.
Carries Karen in his arms to get her help despite the risk she poses.
Insists on trying to save Karen instead of killing her immediately.
Stares down Whistler to advocate for Karen's chance at survival.
Carries Karen carefully into the workshop and insists on trying to save her despite the risk, showing decisiveness and confidence in his judgment.
Engages in a tense but controlled exchange with Whistler, demonstrating clear communication and leadership under pressure.
Follows Whistler's instructions to watch Karen closely and be prepared to act if she turns, showing responsibility and situational awareness.
Holds Karen tightly and provides physical support while she suffers intense pain from the antidote injection, despite his discomfort with the nursemaid role.
Forces Karen back to allow Whistler to inject the antidote despite her resistance, showing decisiveness and understanding of the urgency.
Holds Karen firmly and provides physical support while she endures intense pain, despite feeling uncomfortable in the nursemaid role.
Stares down the camera and fires his crossbow at the vampire club massacre footage, indicating readiness and tactical response.
Fires his crossbow at the vampire club massacre footage, disrupting their plans.
Fires his crossbow at the camera monitoring the vampire club massacre, disrupting their surveillance.
No direct action or statement from Blade in this excerpt; he remains absent or silent during the debate.
Allows Karen to see his sword and keeps a locket with a photo of Vanessa on it, suggesting sentimental value and trust by leaving these personal items accessible.
Shows impatience and brusqueness when telling Whistler to 'Just do it, old man' regarding the serum injection.
Allows himself to be strapped into a restraint chair and injected with an increased dose of serum without resistance, showing patience and trust in Whistler's expertise.
Clutches Whistler's hand tightly during a violent seizure, showing trust and connection.
Blocks Karen's exit with sword in hand, warning her she shouldn't be there.
Endures a violent seizure caused by the serum with intense physical struggle but maintains control and does not panic.
Blocks Karen's exit with sword in hand, asserting control over the situation and preventing unauthorized access.
Helps Karen despite the risk to himself.
Calls Karen's actions 'stupidity' when asked why he helped her.
Expresses distrust and warns Karen that if she turns, he will kill her.
Clearly identifies the vampire threat and explains it succinctly to Karen.
Decides to help Karen despite the risk, showing calculated judgment.
Expresses distrust toward Karen due to potential danger, demonstrating cautious and realistic assessment.
Decides to eliminate Karen if she turns, showing decisiveness and readiness to act.
Scowls and gives a blunt answer ('Stupidity') when asked why he helped Karen, which may reflect poor interpersonal skills or lack of tact.
Strings a tarnished locket around his neck as if it were an amulet, showing a personal, possibly sentimental gesture.
Tells Karen he saved her life once but does not plan on making a habit of it, and bluntly advises her to leave the city by nightfall.
Shows no patience for Karen's disbelief and is dismissive of her concerns, emphasizing the danger she is in without offering comfort.
Suiting up with body armor and loading ammunition carefully before the hunt.
Inspects and sights down a modified pistol, showing attention to detail and preparedness.
Pulls the trigger on an empty chamber to check weapon readiness.
Explains the difficulty of killing vampires and their regenerative abilities, demonstrating knowledge and experience.
Advises Karen to leave the city by nightfall for her safety, showing practical judgment and concern.
Shows little patience for disbelief or questioning, responding bluntly to Karen's skepticism.
Tells Karen to leave immediately for her own safety, showing concern for her well-being despite the harshness.
Dismisses Karen's hope of going to the police bluntly, indicating a lack of patience or empathy for her situation.
Tells Karen to give up on going to the police because she would be dead before filing a complaint, showing awareness of the danger and realistic assessment of the situation.
Slings his CAR-15 onto his shoulder and impatiently orders Karen to get in the car, demonstrating readiness and decisiveness.
No direct action or statement by Blade in the excerpt; presence implied but no demonstration of skill or intelligence.
Warns Karen to keep her eyes open because 'They're everywhere.'
Drives Karen safely to her apartment and ensures she gets out before leaving.

Leaves Karen alone to enter a potentially dangerous building but ensures she is prepared and aware.

Bursts in to save Karen from Gideon, violently subdues the attacker to protect her.
Bursts through the door dramatically, quickly disarms and incapacitates Gideon with precise and overwhelming physical force.
Maintains control and dominance over a dangerous opponent, showing confidence and skill in combat.
Checks on Karen's well-being after the fight, asks if she is okay.
Admits to using Karen as bait but is blunt and dismissive when she expresses concern.
Kneels next to Gideon and inspects his injuries, showing attentiveness.
Explains the situation and the vampire glyph to Karen patiently and informatively.
Dismisses Karen's worry about Gideon's safety with a curt 'Get over it.'
Anticipates that someone would come after Karen and sets a trap by using her as bait, successfully capturing Gideon.
Calmly inspects Gideon's neck and identifies a cryptic glyph, demonstrating knowledge of vampire-related symbols and their significance.
Explains complex vampire lore clearly and confidently to Karen, showing expertise and communication skills.
Dismisses Karen's concerns about using her as bait with a blunt 'Get over it,' showing a lack of empathy or consideration for her feelings.
Shoves Gideon against the car and violently interrogates him.
Threatens to kill Gideon despite Karen's objections.
Shows frustration and anger when Gideon escapes and Karen interferes.
Does not heed Karen's moral objections, prioritizing his mission over human life.

Interrogates Gideon aggressively to get information about his destination.
Attempts to shoot Gideon to prevent him from warning others, showing decisiveness and tactical thinking.
Loses Gideon when he escapes after the struggle with Karen, indicating a failure to secure the target.
Shows frustration and anger after Gideon escapes, indicating emotional response that may impair judgment.
Harshly tells Doctor to 'pull your head out of your ass' and warns about the brutal reality of the world.
Leaves without looking back after delivering a blunt warning, showing no attempt to comfort or engage further.
Explains the harsh reality of the world clearly and confidently to Karen, demonstrating awareness and control of the situation.
Slips his glasses back on and leaves without hesitation, showing decisiveness and focus.
Climbs out of car armed and moves cautiously through a dangerous alley, ready to engage threats with his sword, stopping just short of harming an ally.
Immediately draws sword and nearly kills Karen when startled, then harshly scolds her for following him.
Lowers sword after realizing Karen is not a threat, allowing her to recover.
Engages Karen in conversation, explaining vampire markings and safe-houses, sharing knowledge.
Whirls and draws his sword instantly at a sound behind him, nearly decapitating Karen, showing quick reflexes and situational awareness.
Immediately recognizes vampire markings disguised as graffiti and interprets their meaning accurately, demonstrating knowledge and intelligence.
Questions Karen's judgment harshly but realistically, showing confidence and experience in assessing danger.
Dismisses the possibility of a cure for vampirism outright, which may indicate closed-mindedness or overconfidence in his knowledge.
Recognizes Karen's strength and willingness to fight, patiently instructs her on vampire weaknesses and weapon use.
Snorts derisively when Karen admits she doesn't know how to use the gun.
Commands potential donors to leave the clinic to protect them from danger.
Backhands Tanaka hard enough to loosen his teeth during interrogation.
Clearly explains vampire weaknesses and proper weapons to Karen, demonstrating knowledge and confidence.
Hands Karen a loaded gun with silver hollow-points and instructs her on aiming, showing preparedness and skill.
Enters the clinic boldly, commands everyone to leave, and quickly neutralizes a threat by physically subduing a nurse.
Snorts derisively when Karen admits she doesn't know how to use the gun, showing some impatience but also confidence in his own skills.
Shoots up the supply room aggressively, intimidating Tanaka.
Lets Tanaka go despite having the chance to kill him.
Identifies the glyph on Tanaka, showing attention to detail and knowledge.
Forcibly gains access to the blood supply by shooting the fridge lock open, demonstrating decisiveness and resourcefulness.
Uses intimidation effectively by threatening Tanaka with his rifle, showing confidence and control.
Stops shooting and lets Tanaka go despite earlier readiness to kill, showing strategic patience and confidence in his plan.
Follows Tanaka using a cell-phone scanner, indicating tactical awareness and use of technology.
Explains to Karen how to identify vampires by their behavior and scent, sharing his knowledge openly.
Points out and labels people as vampires, including a 'whore on the corner,' in a blunt and possibly judgmental manner.
Uses a cell-phone scanner to track a signal and successfully connects to a contact despite initial dead ends.
Observes and identifies vampires by subtle behavioral and sensory cues, demonstrating keen perception and knowledge.
Jokes about being worse than vampires to Karen, showing a dark sense of humor but also a form of openness.
Uses violence to force entry by crashing through the doorman, showing aggression and disregard for social niceties.
Identifies vampires by subtle cues like movement and smell, demonstrating keen observation skills.
Prepares weapons (sword, satchel, shotgun) before entering a dangerous situation, showing readiness and tactical planning.

Shoves a drunk college kid's face to prevent interference.

Protects Karen by nodding for her to enter the elevator first.

Interrogates Tanaka effectively, using intimidation and revealing his own supernatural nature to gain information.
Finds and activates a hidden trigger to reveal a secret elevator entrance.
Detects Tanaka's attempt to draw a gun behind him through reflection in his sunglasses and shoots accurately over his shoulder.

Explains the nature of the vampire archives patiently to Karen, correcting her misconceptions without mockery.
Signals Karen to be quiet and leads her carefully through the archives, showing protective behavior.

Draws his sword immediately upon hearing the secret tongue, demonstrating readiness and decisiveness.

Lunges forward and sinks the tip of his sword into Pearl's throat to prevent deletion of important information.

Commands Karen to shoot Pearl if he moves, demonstrating confident leadership and control of the situation.
Attempts to reach for his rifle when vampires attack but is quickly overwhelmed and pinned against the wall, failing to prevent capture.
Struggles violently against Quinn's assault, showing resilience.
Laughs in the face of pain and imminent danger, showing defiance and calm.
Uses a hidden radio to call for help, indirectly protecting others.

Knocks Karen to the ground while escaping.

Leans against the tunnel wall, grunting as he yanks the stake from his shoulder, then uses a light-stick to illuminate the area despite the presence of cockroaches.
Yanks Karen down the tunnel, telling her to go and that Whistler can take care of himself.

Blade advances on Frost confidently after being freed from the blood-bubble, showing resilience and tactical awareness.
Blade makes a confident taunt to Frost, indicating psychological insight and confidence in his position.
Blade is initially trapped in a blood-bubble, unable to free himself, showing a momentary lack of control or inability to counter Frost's attack.
Hesitates to strike his mother, catching her piteous gaze despite her monstrous appearance.
Lunges forward to kill both Frost and Vanessa by driving his sword through them, causing a violent explosion.
Hesitates momentarily due to emotional conflict when Frost uses Vanessa as a shield, showing a momentary weakness.
Recognizes and steels himself to overcome his emotional hesitation, demonstrating mental strength and resolve.
Successfully executes a precise and decisive attack by driving the sword through Vanessa and Frost simultaneously, resulting in their destruction.
Is thrown back and overwhelmed by the powerful backlash of occult energy, indicating vulnerability to the consequences of his actions.
Sheds tears for the first time, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Embraces Karen, holding her for a long time, indicating trust and affection.
Reflects on a new beginning with Karen, showing hope and connection.
Rises to his feet after being blown across the sanctuary, retrieves the hilt of his shattered weapon, and stoops to pick up a damaged locket, showing resilience and focus despite injury.
Sheds tears for the first time in a lifetime, showing emotional vulnerability.

Curtis.Action: Swears professional curiosity and respects Karen's boundary of five minutes and no talk about 'us'.
Grins beneath his mask after Karen admits to second thoughts, showing a playful, sincere side.
